page.title: 06LIFE IN TINGRITH
page.content: Tingrith is a tiny hamlet with a {population}of about 175. It is a very quiet rural backwater with no shops or post office. There is a{Village Hall} which houses the{Judo Club}on Monday afternoons and the local branch of the {Womens Institute.}The elderly residents join with those of the neighbouring villages of Eversholt and Milton Bryan for The{Triple Club}which is held in Eversholt. The Parish Church of St Nicholas is of ironstone in the Perpendicular style and was rebuilt in the late 15th century and restored in 1845. It retains some early features such as a 10-sided 13th century font and early Victorian stained glass. A painting over the altar is said to be by Rubens and was presented by the King of Holland.
